metadata.title: CVE-2024-35890 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: gro:fix ownership transfer If packets are GROed with fraglist they might besegmented later on and continue their journey in the stack. Inskb_segment_list those skbs can be reused as-is. This is an issue as theirdestructor was removed in skb_gro_receive_list but not the reference totheir socket, and then they can't be orphaned. Fix this by also removingthe reference to the socket. For example this could be observed, kernel BUGat include/linux/skbuff.h:3131! (skb_orphan) RIP:0010:ip6_rcv_core+0x11bc/0x19a0 Call Trace: ipv6_list_rcv+0x250/0x3f0__netif_receive_skb_list_core+0x49d/0x8f0netif_receive_skb_list_internal+0x634/0xd40 napi_complete_done+0x1d2/0x7d0gro_cell_poll+0x118/0x1f0 A similar construction is found inskb_gro_receive, apply the same change there.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
